channel.title: CFG > SQL Converters
channel.description:
http://www.mediafire.com/?frj4rycg416qqq2
Basically, if you are switching from CFG/etc to SQL files, these converters will help you in doing so.
Note: This is only recommended for high quality programmers, because there are a few bugs overall in each of these.
Included folders: "SQLFiles" - Contains my SQL table structures "Shops" - Contains shop converter "Ints" - I used for converting the ints from a char file to SQL table structure format (RECOMMENDED YOU MODIFY HEAVILY) "NPCs" - Contains converter for NPC data to SQL table structure format (Recommended you modify, my server had an odd cfg file compared to most) "Spawns" - Converts NPC spawns to SQL table structure format (Also recommended you modify)
And of course, a compiler for the overall download and a run batch file for each. P.S. Ignore 'Todo'; was a list of what I had left to do. Cbf re-uploading the archive. Also: Ignore the class in the main index of the folder, it was so I didn't have to write a compiler to compile multiple locations.
Enjoy, and I will not post a virus scan. If you think that I would truly embed a virus in this, get a life >.> If someone else posts a virus scan, I'll gladly put it on the post.
Edit: If you are trying to make another converter, read the converters and figure it out yourself. ;D

item.title: CFG > SQL Converters
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

You diamond. How very convenient, thanks. It’s only a few int changes to convert to no-doze.

Read full topic

item.title: CFG > SQL Converters
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:405543”][quote author=redapplezftw link=topic=502536.msg3676566#msg3676566 date=1311281182]
first post
[/quote]

Not really. Post something about the topic, otherwise it’s considered spam.

Seems cool I guess. Don’t completely understand SQL files and shit yet.[/quote]

Neither do I. Luckily, I was using No-Doze (which included SQL files) and it helped me out a bit. These converters are basically just the strings he (whoever it is) wrote, modified.

Read full topic

Note: This is only recommended for high quality programmers, because there are a few bugs overall in each of these.

“SQLFiles” - Contains my SQL table structures

And of course, a compiler for the overall download and a run batch file for each.
P.S. Ignore ‘Todo’; was a list of what I had left to do. Cbf re-uploading the archive. Also: Ignore the class in the main index of the folder, it was so I didn’t have to write a compiler to compile multiple locations.

Enjoy, and I will not post a virus scan. If you think that I would truly embed a virus in this, get a life >.>
